about_the_game:
Explore a detailed simulation of our natural world and the forces that shape it.  Players use a set of simple tools to modify the landscape, change rainfall patterns, temperature and tectonics and then watch as the simulation turns their input into a realistic living world.  

The simulation operates on a scale never seen before, running entirely on the GPU in order to harness the full power of modern computers.  Worlds are huge- up to 16,000 km2 in size progressing hundreds of years every second yet zoomable all the way down to individual plants and animals living in real time.  

A series of interacting systems model how the earth evolves:

  • Water flows over the map creating complex river systems that change the landscape.  Mountains erode and produce realistic formations, as the sediment is carried downstream and deposited in floodplains or river deltas

  • Players can modify rainfall and temperature to create seasonal variations.  Create a world with tropical monsoon conditions and see a savannah flourish, or change the temperature to be colder and watch as glaciers take over and scour the landscape, leaving behind U-shaped valleys and glacial lakes when they retreat

  • Plants and animals flourish in the world depending on the local conditions such as rainfall and temperature.  Explore boreal forests, mangrove swamps, savannah plains, jungles, deserts and steppe grasslands amongst others

  • Different rock and material types have different properties and produce varied landscapes as they erode.  Lava cools into igneous rocks whereas deposits from rivers form sedimentary rocks. Alternating layers of rocks produce different topologies as they erode, with slot canyons, stepped canyons and mesas viewable amongst other formations

  • Plate tectonics simulates different types of plate interactions with divergent, convergent and transform plate boundaries producing different resulting landscapes

  • More systems are planned in the future, such as wind, humidity and air pressure, weather systems, ocean currents and sand dunes

Worlds created in Terra Firma 2 are able to be saved, loaded, and exported to other systems, either as heightmaps or via an exporter to your favourite voxel based game.

pc_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • OS *: Windows 7+
  • Processor: Intel Core i5-6600K @ 3.50GHz or AMD Ryzen 5 1600 @ 3.2 GHZ
  • Memory: 2048 MB RAM
  • Graphics: Dedicated Graphics Card with 3GB VRAM

Recommended:
  • OS *: Windows 7+
  • Processor: Intel Core i7-6700 @ 3.40GHz or AMD Ryzen 7 2700X @ 3.7 GHZ
  • Memory: 8192 MB RAM

short_description: Create and explore exquisite natural worlds in this simulation of immense scale and detail. Change the landscape and then watch it erode and transform into a living world all the way down to individual plants and animals.
